1.text: Wine is a scorner—strong drink is noisy, And any going astray in it is not wise.

2.text: The fear of a king is a growl as of a young lion, He who is causing him to be wroth is wronging his soul.

3.text: An honour to a man is cessation from strife, And every fool intermeddleth.

4.text: Because of winter the slothful plougheth not, He asketh in harvest, and there is nothing.

5.text: Counsel in the heart of a man is deep water, And a man of understanding draweth it up.

6.text: A multitude of men proclaim each his kindness, And a man of stedfastness who doth find?

7.text: The righteous is walking habitually in his integrity, O the happiness of his sons after him!

8.text: A king sitting on a throne of judgment, Is scattering with his eyes all evil,

9.text: Who saith, ‘I have purified my heart, I have been cleansed from my sin?’

10.text: A stone and a stone, an ephah and an ephah, Even both of them are an abomination to Jehovah.

11.text: Even by his actions a youth maketh himself known, Whether his work be pure or upright.

12.text: A hearing ear, and a seeing eye, Jehovah hath made even both of them.

13.text: Love not sleep, lest thou become poor, Open thine eyes—be satisfied with bread.

14.text: ‘Bad, bad,’ saith the buyer, And going his way then he boasteth himself.

15.text: Substance, gold, and a multitude of rubies, Yea, a precious vessel, are lips of knowledge.

16.text: Take his garment when a stranger hath been surety, And for strangers pledge it.

17.text: Sweet to a man is the bread of falsehood, And afterwards is his mouth filled with gravel.

18.text: Purposes by counsel thou dost establish, And with plans make thou war.

19.text: A revealer of secret counsels is the busybody, And for a deceiver with his lips make not thyself surety.

20.text: Whoso is vilifying his father and his mother, Extinguished is his lamp in blackness of darkness.

21.text: An inheritance gotten wrongly at first, Even its latter end is not blessed.

22.text: Do not say, ‘I recompense evil,’ Wait for Jehovah, and He delivereth thee.

23.text: An abomination to Jehovah are a stone and a stone, And balances of deceit are not good.

24.text: From Jehovah are the steps of a man, And man—how understandeth he his way?

25.text: A snare to a man is he hath swallowed a holy thing, And after vows to make inquiry.

26.text: A wise king is scattering the wicked, And turneth back on them the wheel.

27.text: The breath of man is a lamp of Jehovah, Searching all the inner parts of the heart.

28.text: Kindness and truth keep a king, And he hath supported by kindness his throne.

29.text: The beauty of young men is their strength, And the honour of old men is grey hairs.

30.text: The bandages of a wound thou removest with the evil, Also the plagues of the inner parts of the heart!
